hint.text: There are 2 arithmetic progressions which needs to be determined with the help of their first term and common difference.

solution.text:
distance between A to B is = _{{j*0.5}}_
So for the first km Rohan will be charged \(a_1=_{k}_\)
and for the second km Rohan will be charged \(a_2=_{k}_+_{l}_=_{{k+l}}_\)
and for the third km Rohan will be charged \(a_3=_{k}_+\,2*_{l}_=_{{k+(2*l)}}_\)
Now distance between B to C is = _{{j*0.5}}_
So for the 4th km Rohan will be charged \(b_1=_{m}_\)
and for the 5th km Rohan will be charged \(b_2=_{m}_+_{n}_ =_{{m+n}}_\)
and for the 6th km Rohan will be charged \(b_3=_{m}_+\,2*_{n}_=_{{m+(2*n)}}_\)
Total money spent = \(a_1+a_2+a_3+b_1+b_2+b_3 = _{{3*(k+l+m+n)}}_\)

content.text:
Rohan wants to travel from point A to Point C via B.
B is at the midpoint of the _{j}_ kilometers road joining A and C.
From A to B the only conveyance available is an auto rickshaw at a fare of Rs _{k}_ for the first km and Rs _{l}_ more than the previous km for each additional km.
From B to C the only conveyance available is an Ola Cab at a fare of Rs _{{m}}_ for the first km and Rs _{{n}}_ more than the previous km for each additional km.
.
Find the total money that Rohan spends on his travel?
